Lunarpine strides forward, quickly covering the ground between him 
and Striker. The hot weather put a strain on him he wasn't used to. 
He found himself short of breath, and panting with each movement. It 
was hot, something he didn't expect. The cold blustery weather in the 
northern section of what will one day be Canada was his climate. This 
would be more difficult to adapt to than he origionally thought.

He approached the ship cautiously, hoping none of the survivors had 
an itchy triggerfinger.

"Striker what's the situation? do they need medical assistance?"

 --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> Yeah, you can have Cheetor, Earth.
> 
> I'll take it that you're firing at The Cybertronian Fire, JP?
> 
> ::Kluster/Striker/Prowl/Ramulus::
> 
> Striker looks at Kluster questioningly as his comm-link plays back 
> Lunarpine's message. Kluster nods, "Call him on in."
> 
> "All clear," he responds to Lunarpine, "A bunch of friends here. 
You can join 
> me."
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Prowl nods at Brooder's reply.
> 
> "I'm in charge temporarily. If you want to help, you can help 
repair the Ark. 
> Do you have any spare computer consoles?"
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> Ramulus runs up behind Primal.
> 
> "Welcome Primal," he says, transforming, "My name's Ramulus."
